page.title: 01An Overview of HIMBLETON
page.content: This is a rural area 9 miles east of Worcester , 7 miles south-east of Droitwich Spa , and about 3 miles north of the A422 - the main Worcester to Stratford-upon-Avon route. It is a typically farming comunity with surrounding farms , estates and hamlets. These mainly comprise of Earls Common , Phepson , Broughton Green , Sale Green , Saleway and of course Himbleton. Himbleton lies on a rural through route between Worcester and Redditch , it has a 13th centuary church , Manor , Village Hall , First School , Public House and Cider House. The land usage is almost entirely farming. The local Parish magasine is the Bow Brook News , named after Bow Brook which runs through the centre of Himbleton and is prone to flooding each winter.
